website_summaries.verdict: With excessive amounts of comfort, support, and stability, KEEN’s Newport H2 can be considered among the must-buys. This exceedingly lightweight footwear provides exceptional traction and requires virtually zero break-in time. Its further upsides include a quick-drying upper, roomy toe box, and anti-odor footbed.Many people, however, aren’t appreciative of the sandal’s below-average stitching and underperformance against intrusive debris. Overall, this KEEN sandal remains sought-after for all its pros.
pros: The KEEN Newport H2 gets excellent remarks from many satisfied owners for its amazing comfort
Quite a number of reviewers have praised the high level of traction this sandal provides on both wet and dry terrain
The Newport H2 has excellent arch support, according to many satisfied users
An expert and a handful of consumers lauds the sandal for providing great stability on uneven terrain
A majority of buyers appreciate the sandal for its quick-drying characteristic
This KEEN footwear requires minimal-to-no break-in time, based on scores of positive reviews
The KEEN Newport H2 is feather-like, according to a combination of experts and numerous consumers
Many wearers applaud the sandal for performing well against foot odor
cons: Quite a number of reviewers expect more from the Newport H2 in terms of durability
Many of these people report ankle strap stitching problems after only a few months of use
Removing debris while wearing the sandal is quite impossible, according to some disgruntled owners
A small percentage of users experienced excessive foot sweating with prolonged use of the sandal

customer_reviews.title: Great Look, Great Fit, but Didn't Last SEVEN Months
customer_reviews.text: I discovered these sandals on the feet of some friends who I know to research everything, so I wanted to believe. I bought myself a pair ($100 plus, forget exactly) last November 21, 2014. They fit and looked great for about 3 months...then the stitching started to fall apart on one shoe. A month later, the stitching on the other side began to unravel. The sides of both shoes have now completely separated and it's too late for Amazon to take them back. If someone from Keen is reading, I'd be interested to know if my experience is something of which you already knew.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I generally love Keens, I think I have about 5 pairs of other Keen shoes in circulation. I've rarely worn these and the threading is already coming apart. I've asked to have them fixed or replaced, and my purchase is out of the return window. I will certainly think twice about buying another pair of these Keen shoes. Really disappointed. If Keen is able to help, I'd appreciate it!
customer_reviews.author: Randall Carter

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Front strap blew out with normal use. See photo. Bought in winter and used for 2 months in summer. Can't return. Thought I was buying quality. I am contacting Keen to see if they will stand by their product more than Amazon. Next time I'll order direct with this type of return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Maison

customer_reviews.title: Durable and they get much more comfortable as you break them in. Takes a while.
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my third pair. They are durable and look well enough to do what I want to do which is canoeing / racing sailboats and ski boats and then going from wet to dry, wet to dry, etc. When you hike you will get dirt in under your toes and if you are in mud a lot they really aren't great unless you can slosh your foot around to rinse them out in the water. ***** WARNING ***** Keens run a bit wide but the main setback to these is that they get HOT and SWEATY when you wear them and you can't wait to take them off at times.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Shameful quality
customer_reviews.text: These Keen sandals began falling apart after only 2 months of use. I walked in them around 2 hours per day (sidewalk walking) During that period. The sandal's stitching on the heel disintegrated and the stitching is not covered by Keen's warranty. For costly sandals such as these, falling apart after 120 hours of light use is unacceptable. If you are looking for sandals, I recommend looking at a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Sampson

customer_reviews.title: If They Rip Wearing Them at the Doctor's Office, I'd Hate to See What Happens on the Trail.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these sandals last summer 2016 in a different color and they lasted fine. No wear at all and the size fit perfect. I ordered another pair in January 2017 in blue and they arrived a bit tighter but still wearable. The side band started to come undone after wearing them only a few times around the store or the doctor's office. No hiking or kayaking yet. I checked Keen's site and they only offer a 30 day return. I WON'T be buying Keen's anymore. Back to Tevas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like Keen hybrid shoes.
customer_reviews.text: This was my second pair of Keen sandals. The first pair was leather and lasted 7 years. This pair is synthetic webbing, very comfortable and I hope they last as long. I wear size 11, bought size 13 like my old ones and they fit perfectly. They run one or two sizes small compared to a normal shoe size. They're a bit expensive but sometimes you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: D. Vogel

customer_reviews.title: Keen Quality Has Decreased?
customer_reviews.text: I bought these Keen sandals for my husband just under 2 years ago. Within a year they started falling apart, with the stitching coming out. I had a pair of Keen sandals very similar that I bought 6 years ago and they still look great. We live in Northern IL, so he only wears these sandals about 4 months out of the year. I am very disappointed with these sandals and hope this is not an indication that Keen has lowered their standards.
customer_reviews.author: R. McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Quality declining on newport sandals
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be Keen's flagship sandal, and I've bought about 7 of them over the last 7-8 years. The old ones were built like tanks, and the material would wear out or the soles would grind off after a couple years. Now, stitching is failling, and the grey footbed on this most recent purchase really sucked in that my foot got sore under 10k steps. Keen needs to employ some QC on their product, since these newports are not cheap! Plus the plastic footbed is much sweatier than the old leather footbeds which I loved. Plus, somehow, it's affecting the arch support as well. Keen, stop resting on your laurels!
customer_reviews.author: Sal Onassis

customer_reviews.title: Truly hate these sandals/watershoes.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the look and the concept but they really are awful to walk in. Incredibly poorly designed. The opening is right where your little toe is and when you walk your small toe ends up out of the sandal making it incredibly uncomfortable. I got the smallest size I could squeeze my feet into and my toes are all the way into the front of the sandal but my small toes fall out the opening. If they had just encased the toes on the outside like they did the inside these might have been perfect, but they didn't, so I truly hate them.
customer_reviews.author: D. Diamant

customer_reviews.title: Good, comfortable sandal.
customer_reviews.text: These are my 3rd pair. They fit well and my go to sandal. I live in Florida so these get almost daily usage year round. I have had to have the other pairs repaired because the loop on strap in back tore loose on both previous pairs. The sole wears very well, fit is great and they are highly comfortable. I am using my oldest pair as water shoes for playing water volleyball on an almost daily basis. They will soon need to be retired. Good sandal overall, could use more stitching on the back as I indicated above. The price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy These, They fall apart within Weeks!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what happened to Keen quality. While I really like the fit, feel and function of Newports, they have become cheap junk, that fall apart within a few weeks of daily wear. The side switching comes out, the straps over the foot pull out of the sole. For what these things cost, you should be able to get more than two months use of them before they fall completely apart. VERY DISAPPOINTED IN KEEN!
customer_reviews.author: John S. Alsobrook

customer_reviews.title: **UPDATED** AFTER 1 YEAR
customer_reviews.text: They are friggen great for anything water related. The wind passing through feels so good! UPDATED I would not get these again, iv probably worn them a dozen times just going to the lake, Not alot of running or walking. Just being in the water. The sides that show the logo on both shoes started to tear asap and last week i finally broke and had to re sow them back together with dental floss. Its a known issue that keen will not help you with. GET A DIFFERENT STYLE
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Sandal way too narrow
customer_reviews.text: This sandal is way too narrow, although the length seems to be about right. It lacks any adjustment for width. There are better options out there. The Grition outdoor hiking sandal works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Madison Jim

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart when tested
customer_reviews.text: I normally love Keene and buy them over other brands. But, I never lived these shoes and felt like they were off. On Sunday, they were put to the test when I flipped in a river and had to grab and hold my son 100 yes downstream. The rigging on one shoe tore and fell out. Both shoes were ruined. The shoes were not cut out to do their most basic job. Maybe I got a bad pair, but I am buying Tevas to replace them
customer_reviews.author: AMM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I had not heard of Keen (or of hiking sandals for that matter) before I purchased these on a recommendation from a friend. I got them specifically for a hiking trip to Sedona and came away very impressed. They required no "breaking in" and were more comfortable than I expected. The thick soles absorb shock and prevent any sharp rocks from hurting or injuring your feet, and the toe protection saved me from several potentially painful experiences. In addition, they have excellent grip, and allow your feet to "breathe". The fact that they are waterproof is a great bonus. It also makes them easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: M. Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Like a custom footbed with straps
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure this is my fourth pair from Keen. They have proven plenty durable by my standards. I have had two pair of sandals and two of the flip-flops. I used to work in the ski biz at a slope side shop that specialized in custom footbeds and boot work. These sandals are about as close as one can get to a true custom bed. They offer great support without being intrusive. I'm a fan for life, don't change a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Bean

customer_reviews.title: Like others, seem in same area came apart after 2 months on the Trails
customer_reviews.text: Went hiking the Alpine Wilderness, not too bad 4600 ft eleveation change, 9.5 miles in. What sucks is the seems on my Keens are now coming undone and I have more hikes planned but these are what i bought to hike in. For hiking they are perfect, good grip and fit great BUT the construction quality is garbage. After 2 months they fall apart and Amazon has changed its return policies on defective items they adhere to a strict 30 day policy even when they advertise items with warranties. Do not buy from Amazon, buy elsewhere and get a real warranty and ability to return.
customer_reviews.author: MrTyTheGuy

customer_reviews.title: Buy these now!!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my boyfriend’s b- day and he loved them more then any shoe ever. Yes they are a bit of a dad Sandle but they hold up to what they are advertised as. You want to go swimming, hiking, boating, or even to a bbq all work. They lasted 3 years of hard wear and the strap finally tore when he was helping a friend push his car out of a ditch. Needles to say would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Never

customer_reviews.title: Side came unstitched after less than a year of minimal use
customer_reviews.text: I got these a year ago and only wear them in the summer. At that, I rarely wear them and only for walking my dogs - so, I'm not hard on them. I can't believe they came unstitched. My wife had a pair that lasted for almost 20 years before they started to tear, and she was much harder on them. It seems as though Keen's quality has decreased quite a bit recently. The fit of their sandals has changed, too. I do not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B. Sessa

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't even get them on
customer_reviews.text: I have normally-proportioned size 14 feet. I could not even get my feet into these. Most manufacturer's normal size 14 shoes (Nike, Brooks, New Balance, etc.) fit just fine (well, to be honest, Nike's run pretty narrow in general). Not these. I understand they need to be snug, but it took 5 minutes just to get one on, and then it was so tight on my foot that I was afraid it would cut off the circulation. It's not the soul or last of the shoe which is the problem, but the webbing material. It is very tight over the top of your foot--tight enough to be very uncomfortable in my case. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: ♥ Books and gadgets

customer_reviews.title: Some of the straps had glue that looked like was coming undone
customer_reviews.text: Upon receipt the sandals had dried glue on different areas of the sandals. Some of the straps had glue that looked like was coming undone. I do not know if the sandal was subject to heat prior to shipping that caused glue on this product to melt or if it was poor manufacturing. For a hundred dollars I expect higher quality. I'm returning the sandals and ordering a second pair. I'll update this review upon receipt of the new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: if its not broke,  dont fix it!
customer_reviews.text: Ive been a fan of Keen sandals for many years. Ive owned at least 7 pair. One of the things i've liked about them is that they were always very easy to put on(this is even more important to me now as i get older and less flexible etc. But I'm a little dispointed that a recent design change has made the ankle opening smaller and tighter(less flexible) making these difficult for me to get on/off not to mention a tighter more constrictive feeling fit I dont apreciate much. I liked my Keens lose and comfortable. All i can think of is that "if its not broke dont change it! 😦
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Replacement Keens.  Still comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about going closed-toe, but every time I haven't smashed my toes has turned me into a convert. Only just slightly less breezy. Good comfort, support and design so far. My old pair were all leather, and the rubber/nylon as also been a nice change I worried over nothing about doing. I think some people mentioned not going with your usual size, and going up/down. Whichever it was, they were right, as the size-adjusted ones I got fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: P.D.

customer_reviews.title: The best footwear I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I was first introduced to my Keens when I found a nice used pair at a Goodwill in 2010 while in College. I spent the next 8 years wearing them almost everywhere. I have hiked, mowed, remodeled two houses and even went on two cruises with them. Ten years later they have been retired and are exclusively being used for mowing and other yard work. (Still haven't fallen apart) Recently my wife bought me some brand new Keens and they are 100% the same quality as the originals. She also bought me some Keen steel toed tennis shoes for work that I love. I fully intend to be a Keen wearer for life. Thank you Keen.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Smith

customer_reviews.title: Wish the Men’s Newport had adjustable strap over the instep. Otherwise it’s solid
customer_reviews.text: The Keen Newport sandal is the sherman tank of sandals. They fit well, the toe protection is great, sporty looking, and you can’t kill them. I’ve bought our son a pair every summer of his life since he was 4. He now wears a men’s size. It can hike, nature walk, ride the river, camp, and go out for TexMex dinner at the end of the day. In the south we wear them several months of the year. I do wish Keen kept the adjustable strap over the instep. They’re harder to yank on now without it, and that factor has us looking at Tevas or another alternative this summer. Bummer It’s been a great run Keens. ❤️
customer_reviews.author: CactusTree

customer_reviews.title: falling apart after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst pair of shoes I have ever bought. Not sure if I can trust these purchases on Amazon going forward. within weeks the tongue hook broke, preventing me from pulling on one of the shoes. Yesterday, the whole shoe broke away from the sole. for $150+ you expect quality. These shoes are a total joke! Likely defected crap that Amazon brokered a distribution deal for... yeah, on to your deceptive business practice now Amazon FU Amazon. you are now relegated back to buying batteries and other less $20 purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Oliver

customer_reviews.title: TOO SMALL BY A FULL SIZE
customer_reviews.text: These sandals are great but they are a *FULL SIZE* too small. I ordered a half size bigger than I normally wear (based on the reviews) but they crush my feet and I will probably never wear them. Too bad, because they seem well constructed. That's $100 probably wasted. HOW Hard is it exactly? Measurements are fixed Keen. I suspect this is a tactic to be able to charge more for larger sizes then to purposefully undersize their shoes to make more profit.
customer_reviews.author: TheStig

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Travel Sandals
customer_reviews.text: These are sandals that you can walk all day in, get wet and walk some more, never a blister. The bottoms are razor-siped so traction is great even in the water. There are other sandals that I also like, but for travel, these are the best. Any open toe sandal is a risk, smash your toe and your tour is cut short. With Keens, you can walk around and still wade in the water, climb on and off that bus, and have no worries. Quick dry, super comfortable, don't wear them too tight. I order a half size up.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: sandals
customer_reviews.text: I do like these sandals and I find the fit and function/design is good. I would only make one recommendation, that being if you plan to wear socks, buy the next 1/2 size larger. I wear a 10.5 shoe size in most shoes/boots and these sandals fit nice. But as noted I recommend that you buy at 1/2 size larger if you plan to wear with socks. Working from home and dealing with the moderate cools temps as of late, i do wear socks with these...FYI. Good product and I'll buy the same brand/product again.
customer_reviews.author: JoeAverage-User

customer_reviews.title: Best Shoes I’ve Ever Owned!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, the best all-around shoes I’ve EVER owned. Seriously. My 1st pair lasted 8 years. I wore them traveling to multiple countries, backpacking, cycling, mowing the lawn, sports, etc. SO versatile, keep your feet cool, but provide ALL the protection and durability you need for multiple activities. Waterproof and great for fishing, stream hopping, rock climbing, etc. I know they are an investment, but how many other shoes last EIGHT YEARS under frequent and rigorous use? I think what I’m trying to say is this is a great product and you should buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, switching back to Teva
customer_reviews.text: I got these because we have several pairs for the kids and have had good luck with them. I was pleased at first, but they failed me this week while on a beach trip - the nylon webbing at the outside of the left heel tore, rendering them unusable. I have only used them lightly and consider this failure extremely premature. I have had pairs of Teva’s last for years with much harder use. Ordered myself a new pair of tevas (same style Ive had previously) while sitting on the beach lamenting the death of my keens.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Durden

customer_reviews.title: Great walking sandals
customer_reviews.text: My Husband loves them, we travel to the Caribbean yearly and these are good for hiking, beach, and he likes them as water shoes...I buy him a new pair every couple of years...the older ones graduate to yard work shoes ;-) A++++++
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs size warning
customer_reviews.text: I returned this because it was smaller than it's stated size 13. I have a 12 and a half size foot, and my large toes were rubbing against the toe box. My other pair of size 13 Keens fits just fine. This is not a complaint about the quality. This is a well made product. I have another from this brand that is comfortable and long lasting. It's just that the size is mis-stated. It is a good thing (for the customer) that Amazon's return process is so efficient and painless. It's not so good for Amazon, since it's paying the return freight.
customer_reviews.author: Stirling Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: Seller got them to me fast and they're great
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like about these? I hike and fish and I can wear these for all my outdoor activities. This is my second pair. My first being owned more than a decade ago. They held up really well for years and years and were finally replaced by a different set of keen footwear after several repairs using braided fishing line to keep them intact. I'm hoping the new pair will last for years also. Kudos to the seller who got them to me at a great price and several days earlier than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Bobc

customer_reviews.title: Its okay
customer_reviews.text: First I wanted to talk about sizing. I normally wear a 10 in Merrel and Oboz. I wear a 10 in these with no socks. If you intend on wearing socks, maybe go up a half size? These shoes just fit a bit weird. Not so bad that i'd send them back, they're water shoes so I won't be hiking in them for hours. But, I wouldn't WANT to wear them for hours. Onto the part I hate the most: the laces! They are the worst. Awful. No matter what you can't get these tight.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great, comfortable shoe but stitching is weak
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes last year prior to our Puerto Rico cruise where we were walking on a different island every day. The were great shoes for that purpose. I've only worn them occasionally since then and you tell from the pictures that there's still plenty of tread left on them. Unfortunately, the stitching on side of shoe hasn't held up as you can also see in the attached picture. I have had to drop them off at a local shop to be repaired. I would have thought that these shoes would have been a little better made. I am disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Danger

customer_reviews.title: These are garbage
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed. Stitching came undone on both in only a couple months of random use. This is the second time, I returned them the first time and the stitching came undone in the sam place.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Evans

customer_reviews.title: BEST for Asia travel!
customer_reviews.text: I wore these exclusively on a trip to SE Asia. While I did mostly city walking and public transit, they held up very well. I will definitely keep these around, as they are not quite shoes and not quite sandals. It's a great in-between balance that keeps you from being too hot in humid Asian countries. I also wore them with & without socks on airline flights. Yes over time your feet will smell, but that's easily fixed by... washing your feet. That being said, these are waaaaay better than the Solomon shoes I was previously wearing for Asian travel. Great pair of shoes!
customer_reviews.author: flightguy

customer_reviews.title: Quality of this product is not the best for the price, I expected to last longer that 2 Months.
customer_reviews.text: Keen Over the Quality Policy.: ..."guarantee them to be free from manufacturing defects for one year", So how you will detect a manufacturing defect over a year if you don't know what is the lifespan expected over materials and overall the product and parts?..... Keen States: What’s not covered? Damage caused by normal wear and tear, improper care, misuse, accident, neglect, or the natural breakdown of materials over time....... Basically it cover nothing after arrival or 30 Day I guess; so 30 Day its a Quality Policy, this is nothing for the produce cost, mine didn’t last 2 months for $88 dlls....
customer_reviews.author: Jose Davila

customer_reviews.title: Runs small but know it will stretch a bit.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size up from my normal size and sent them back as they were too tight even knowing the will stretch a little. I reordered another pair two sizes up from normal and there are still very snug but they will fit better in time. This is my fourth pair of Keens in 15 years. I wear them for many tasks and reasons and have never failed me. My last pair held up to my brutality on footwear for 6 years ( I re-glued the soles and continue to wear them for yard work).
customer_reviews.author: B. S.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable sandals that are difficult to get on and off
customer_reviews.text: Once I get these sandals on, they are very comfortable and suitable for hiking. The problem is getting them on and taking them off. The heel strap is unyielding and has no elastic, clasp or Velcro to ease the burden of getting it over your heal. I wore these hiking on Tahiti and Moorea and they very comfortable and airy in the warm humid weather. Be aware though, as sandals, they will allow pebbles and sand to get under your foot and, as stated above, getting them off and on again to clean out the detritus can be trying.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Keen sandals falling apart after one month
customer_reviews.text: Bought these keen sandals after talking with other patrons who love them. I liked them when i got them but after about one month, the elastic separated from the tongue at the seam on both sandals with normal wear. I spent $80 on these and really expected them to last for many years. Only lasted one month. Called Keen to find out about warranty. Very disappointing experience with customer service who showed zero empathy for a customer disappointed with Keen's product. Also, they were extremely difficult to talk to about the information I had with regard to my amazon transaction. Had to give one star but frankly poor product performance and poor customer service deserves zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: DC Camper.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are my second pair of Keens. My first pair lasted every bit of 15 years. I used them as lawn mowing shoes, River shoes, and all around the yard shoes. The new shoes fit slightly smaller than the old shoes. Not enough that I returned them but I wish I got a size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tough sandals! 2nd pair.
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves his original Newport keen sandals that are probably 10 years old. He requested a new pair so ordered them for him. The shoes are virtually indestructible. Some wear on the soles of the 10 year old pair. He wears them all summer long (4-5 months in Kansas)...hopefully the new ones last 10 years also.
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: Not even a month old and already separating
customer_reviews.text: I bought these sandals on August 6, 2019 (delivered Aug 8 2019). I have worn them maybe 8-10 times and while I like the sandal design, and toe protection, they are already separating. I just noticed this yesterday. Not impressed with the quality control. I'll contact Amazon for a replacement and see how long those last. If the same thing happens, I'll switch to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Viking Sailor

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR H2 HIKING
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for wading in Virginia rivers while canoeing and hiking. I had an expectation of the rubber soles giving a positive grip on underwater river rocks. WRONG. No grip. Like sliding around on marbles. I have worn out two pairs of Teva Guide sandals equipped with their Spider Rubber which grips the bottom rocks positively. No uncertainty in your step. I was looking for better toe protection (a Keen plus) and a lessening of the small rocks and sand getting trapped under my foot ( Keen better but still not great). A falling one star for Keen Newport H2 Hiking Shoe. NOT FOR H2 HIKING.
customer_reviews.author: george w moseley

customer_reviews.title: Pure comfort.
customer_reviews.text: I have several pairs of Keens. These are very comfortable and breathable shoes. They are washable and last a long time. I have used these for hiking and they remain comfortable the entire day. They are available in larger sizes which is great sine I wear a size 16.
customer_reviews.author: JPAB

customer_reviews.title: They could last longer, but they’re great sandals!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had many pairs of these over the years. It would be nice if they lasted longer, but I’m very hard on them. In and out of the water all the time and use them for hiking as well. I’ll buy another pair when they have them in the color I wanted. I often have two pairs at a time.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I use them out hiking, kayaking, hot summer days, and at the beach. They are very good quality and fit perfectly. You can use them in dry or wet environments like walking through streams or going into a lake. The toe cover and bottom are made to protect you, good when walking through the woods and water. They are very durable, lasted me around 3 years of heavy use before I had to purchase a new one once the sewn seams near the ankle started to come undone. I would definitely recommend these
customer_reviews.author: Soup

customer_reviews.title: The best Sandal ever made
customer_reviews.text: Keens are by far the best sandals made. I have owned more then 8 pairs. They last and their support/backing of their products are great. My dog had chewed up a pair of my sandal laces and I called Keen to buy some more laces, but they sent me two pairs for free. Definitely will buy more when time comes
customer_reviews.author: Chris Santor

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Sandal for Water Sports
customer_reviews.text: I have four pairs of the Newport H2 sandal which I initially decided to try because of toe protection. I also like their styling, colors and construction. They are comfortable, good for general purpose use and water sports in particular. Could be used for hiking, but there are better choices for that activity. When new, its sole is flexible, providing a good grip on otherwise slippery and wet surfaces such as a boat deck. After a year or two the sole becomes stiff and traction declines considerably, but this happens with every boat shoe I've ever had. The sizing is tight and I found that 1/2 size larger than normal gives me the correct fit.
customer_reviews.author: DKM

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, so far!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a sandal guy, and do not like getting stuck with sandals on if I end up walking around a bunch. These help with that scenario, for sure! They are not as supportive and comfortable as normal shoes, so do not expect them to replace a hiking shoe. I had decent fatigue after 6.5 hours of running around at work one day, but that is not the situation i'll be wearing these in. Now, My number 1 thing is durability. I will update after the summer with durability review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Men's runs small
customer_reviews.text: We have been buying these sandals for years. This year, we needed new ones. 4 of them (different colors and sizes) fit the family great. For some reason, the 9.5 that my husband usually wears was too small. We returned and ordered the 10. Still too small. Ordered the 10.5, it fit in length, but he couldn't even tighten the straps. His feet were pushing through the openings on the sides. Returning and will buy elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: andrea davidson

customer_reviews.title: Color do not look like the pictures !
customer_reviews.text: So Indian ink is really a lighter shade of blue... don’t even come close to the picture.. I got the first pair and I was like this is wrong color then I got the second pair right before I headed to the airport on vac and same color I was like WTH.. so I had no time to go shopping.. so if you want a rust color it’s not Indian ink / rust .. get brown and the H2 soul not as comfortable as the other keen.. it is hard rubber for going in the water but I wish I would have just got the regular one
customer_reviews.author: He knows

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5 days!! Save your money!!
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 5 days of use!!!!! So frustrated because the Keem brand is usually reliable. Can someone reply to my review? I feel I deserve a refund or replacement as these are not an inexpensive shoe & it broke half way thru my camping trip. The heel strap completely broke and came out, it's not even repairable or stitchable!!! It was such a hassle for the second half of my trip. They're completely unusable now. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Barrick

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been buying my sandals from discount stores (like target and Payless) for years and never had any serious complaints. The truth of the mater is I didn’t know what I was missing. When I moved to Haiti in 2016 all my discount sandals fell apart in a matter of weeks(I typically walk 3-5 miles at least three times a week). Either the the sole would start to crumble apart or they would completely separate from the rest of the shoe and my feet would hurt at the end of my day. I’ve had these keens and have absolutely no complaints, they are comfortable, durable and stylish.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Designed to fail.
customer_reviews.text: The connection of the back strap to the sole is designed to fail after a short time. The heavy duty webbing in back, does NOT extend down to the sole, but is connected by light weight cloth, for no apparent reason, other than to cause failure. All the other connections are solid. Now have three pair of lightly used sandals that have failed at this location, that otherwise have many years of wear left.
customer_reviews.author: M. Yates

customer_reviews.title: Walking on a cloud
customer_reviews.text: I have a heel that’s narrower than the rest of my foot which causes every other pair I’ve tried to slip up and down on my heel. I have always returned them. These Keens are some of the most comfortable sandals I’ve ever had. No slipping at all. Great arch support and no rubbing on the side of my Foot or toes.
customer_reviews.author: J Martin

customer_reviews.title: not keen on Keen
customer_reviews.text: At first got the shoes and decided the color would not be good. Then on further inspection I realized the sole was defective, did not sit flat on the floor. I chatted with an agent because I was going to buy a different color but then saw the prices had gone up since I had bought my pair. The agent said I could not get the lower price but offered a five dollar credit. I have not seen it come through yet. I think Amazon must be getting seconds from the reviews I have seen. I will buy locally or go with a different brand. I had always heard Keen was good. Guess I dodged this one.
customer_reviews.author: Yes Sam

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful sandals
customer_reviews.text: We live in Southern GA so my husband wears these sandals frequently. This is his second pair and are a go-to choice for him. He wears them to wash cars, errands, travel, yard work, etc. He has ankle problems and these do not rub funny or aggravate the skin at all, good arch support, toes are protected and they are comfy for all-day wearing.
customer_reviews.author: Razzy2001

customer_reviews.title: Good Sandal
customer_reviews.text: Usually wear a size 9.5 M and ordered a size 10 M based upon reviews of the shoe from others. "Felt" a little large initially but after a while they seemed ok. Comfortable sandals. Usually wear Teva products but couldn't find what I liked in the Teva line. Elastic laces make adjustment easy. I usually don't put a lot of wear on the sandals so I anticipate that these will last for a while. These are waterproof but I don't get them wet so I can't address that option. Really like the blue and gray color though. Overall very satisfied with the sandal.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bill

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Wore these right out of the box on a short vacation, outdoors walking around asphalt and some trail hiking also and they were very comfortable. The siping on the sole provides great traction over rocks and dirt and inclines no slippage at all. Recently wore these to the beach with no socks and they were very comfortable in and out of water. Not much you can do about sand and small gravel getting into them in water situations so if this bothers you maybe look at something else.
customer_reviews.author: grandamage

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Had my first pair for 12 years and now my wife purchased the new pair for my birthday. Still wear the originals for walking the dog in water areas, etc. as other than bottom and edge rubber wear, they are still fully useable. Walked 11 miles arouind the Cathedral Rock trail in Sedonna, AZ. with these shoes and my feet were fine......very comfortable. Will start taking the new ones for trips. Very happy with these sandals.....extremely durable and once broken in, very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: GRS

customer_reviews.title: Had to exchange for half size larger
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice looking, comfortable, durable pair of sandals. Based on my own satisfaction with Keen sandals, of which I own several pairs, I gave these to my husband for his birthday. As noted in the headline, his expected size was too snug, but the extra half-size up on the exchanged pair fit great. Keens are comfortable and stylish enough to wear just about every day, just about anywhere you need to be.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: But this is the best I have found for foot support and durability
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Keen Newport H2 for years. I have tried Teva, and they don't have enough toe space to suit me. I started wearing quality footwear years ago after several trips to the podiatrist. I found Keens and Danner boots. Pricy but cheaper than the podiatrist. They are for walking more than standing around. I can get a year out of a pair of Keens plus Danners. And they are shot when I throw them out. All ragged and tread gone. I walk and hike a lot. There is more durable footwear. But this is the best I have found for foot support and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little smaller than advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have had my old pair of Keens for many satisfied years. But after a brief 10 years or more the straps came loose from the sole. I purchased an exact duplicate pair as a replacement but for some reason the back strap of the shoe was much shorter which made it impossible for me to get my foot inside the saddle. I would suggest a minimum of 1⁄2 size larger when you order. Quality is still fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Harris Les Myers

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable sandal
customer_reviews.text: I have had the leather version of these for years. I bought these to try to man made material that should dry quickly. I have found the fit a bit tight to get on over my heal. And the width a bit narrower than the leather version. I like them for walking; they are very comfortable. And the antibacterial foot sole works, no odor. I think I will go back to the Newport leather version next time.
customer_reviews.author: Beltoy

customer_reviews.title: Keen really needs to do some work on their products
customer_reviews.text: These are supposed to be 11.5 and they are more like size 9. Keen also used to be known for wider (than normal) size shoes, but this last one was very narrow. No possibility of me being able to wear it. Would have liked to be able to return, but I waited too long. Cannot recommend these for anyone with wide feet or normal size feet. Construction seemed all right, but no idea about the wearability.
customer_reviews.author: Anon66177

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my son
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son to wear on a Caribbean cruise. I wanted something comfortable that he could walk in all day, as well as wear in and out of the water. They clean easily and dry fast when they get wet. He wasn't too excited about them at first, but he wore them every time we left the ship and never once complained. I had specifically chosen these over another pair I was considering because of the closed toe. That turned out to be a good decision--he did a last minute zip line experience on an excursion and you had to have closed toe shoes. :-)
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as it used to be.... quality problems.
customer_reviews.text: Keen H2 sandlal was my favorite sandal. It was very very well built and super comfortable all around. I used to wear them until bottom wore off. but the most recent one that I have bought, it has some major quality problems. I used it everyday for past six days, but already its inner lining was ripped and sides are coming off. also, it is a lot tighter fit than previous models at the same size. Not at all happy with the quality and Keen need to better their shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Y. YoonTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made and uncomfortable for my Morton's Neuroma
customer_reviews.text: I have Morton's Neuroma on one of my feet and have struggled to find a river sandal that gives the metatarsal support that I need. After lots of research, the Newport H2 seemed to be my answer, but sadly, the molded footbed was not comfortable for me. I ended up finding another Keen model in which the footbed was removable, so I could insert an orthotic. In addition to not fitting me, the particular pair of sandals that I received were poorly made. The stitching and liners were not symmetrical or matching. The label read Mexico.
customer_reviews.author: Runnerz

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these and wears them all the time. We bought them for a trip to Thailand and they make great water shoes as well as hiking shoes for easy-moderate trails (no ankle support if you're doing serious hiking). His only complaint is that his feet get hot in them because of the thick sole, but they do breathe with the top design, and he still loves them. I have the same pair in women's and really like them too - very durable and comfortable and they dry out pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: CMish

customer_reviews.title: The Ultimate Sandle for Adventure Seekers
customer_reviews.text: KEENs were the best purchase I could have made. I bough them specifically for a Caribbean cruise! On that cruise, I wore my keens to snorkel in Grand Cayman, to climb a waterfall in Jamaica, to zip line in Haiti, and take a cooking class in Mexico ( we had to stand a long time). These were comfortable, durable, and look way better than other options. A phenomenal purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great sport sandal
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a half size smaller than I wear in a normal shoe because I would not be wearing socks and fit was perfect. The shoe will stretch a bit over time so if it feels a bit snug right out of the box don't let that worry you. Shoes are comfy and are great for lounging around camp after a day of hiking or sloshing though a creek in the sun. Definitely willing to repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M

customer_reviews.title: Good Sandal.  But had to go up 1 full size to get the right width.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to someone. Good sandal. They liked it. Originally ordered the recipient's normal size (11). That was too small, then tried 11.5. That was still too small. Finally had to go with a size 12. That size fit. It was not the shoe length, but the shoe width that was too tight. As a FYI, after the first exchange, Amazon does not allow a 2nd exchange. You have to return for a refund or credit and re-order the product.
customer_reviews.author: Sundown AL

customer_reviews.title: Great all around summer sandal
customer_reviews.text: Good for most summer activities. At the beach, rafting, canoeing, walking a trail, wading thru a stream, riding a bicycle or at a BBQ these sandals really function well in a wide variety of situations. First pair of Newport's I've owned so I hope I don't see some of the issues others have noted regarding stitching but I've been very happy with KEEN shoes in the past and these are comfortable and protect the toes.
customer_reviews.author: Groundoggy

customer_reviews.title: Great sandal, but inconsistent sizing.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great sandal, but the sizing is inconsistent. I ordered two sizes (men's 10 and 10.5), which were different colors of the same model, but the pair identified as 10.5 was definitely smaller than the 10. The size 10 is about as expected, and the 10.5 seems like a 9.5. I am still curious what a proper 10.5 would feel like, because the 10 is a little tight. Hopefully it will stretch a little.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Howard

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking sandal.
customer_reviews.text: I've worn these daily and with heavy backpacks on long hikes up and down hills. I would have trashed a pair of Birkenstocks months ago with this much wear. Still in perfect shape. I took them to the car wash after this last hiking trip and they look like new. Only downside is they don't dry fast while being worn. Easy to wear as a slip on, back strap fits underneath my foot when the extra support isn't needed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Loy

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of Men's Keen Sandals
customer_reviews.text: These are the second pair of Keen's Newport H2 sandals I have purchased for my husband. It is a great shoe to protect your feet at the beach or while walking over rocks on a hiking trail! My husband also loves wearing them when we go out shopping! After 3 years of wear his first pair is still in great shape! I thought a second pair would be nice for when his first pair is drying! We travel a lot and our Keens make great shoes to wear while we are sightseeing! They really are waterproof and when they are dirty they wash easily in my washing machine!
customer_reviews.author: G. Brady

customer_reviews.title: Better than great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband on a long shot. He is historically hard to fit and generally hard to please when it come to shoes. These were a home run. The roomy toe box is perfect and the construction is sturdy. Very comfortable. He wore them every single day for three weeks in Maui hiking, swimming and even on our morning runs! Can't say enough good things about these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe and Highly Adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Needed a shoe that could be slipped on and off and capable of being worn inside like a slipper and outside without wearing out the sole. The bungie allows the shoe to be adjusted to your foot. Once adjusted you slip on by using the finger loops. The sole was stiff at first but after a couple of days of use loosened up nicely. They fit as expected. There is no slippage so going up and down stairs is no longer poses a danger. These shoes are exactly what I needed and I expect to buy more in the future. Extremely comfortable even when wearing all day.
customer_reviews.author: Ponkow

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction and customer service
customer_reviews.text: The keens run a little narrow.After 6 months and not much use the cord broke. I contacted customer service and was told my warranty claim was denied because it was considered laces. I don’t understand how that is considered laces and how I would replace them. They should have replaced them. My first pair of keens were great but their quality and customer service has since declined.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, fits perfect, stylish
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband because he loved the fit and comfort from his last pair, which finally wore out after a few years. The color and style are also perfect! He prefers sandals that cover his toes and can be worn hiking or to a restaurant - he is not a flip flop guy, so these fit the bill. As long as you don’t expect them to last forever, these are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: m ack

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband. Had to hand stitch them back together at a few seems within the first week of wearing them. Very comfortable. Just expected them to last. I bought 2 different pairs for myself and sent both back after wearing them one time and they started to come apart. The first keens I ever bought I still have and they are over 15 years old. He is still wearing these and 2 years later I am having to stitch them together yet again.
customer_reviews.author: Chele

customer_reviews.title: Good Looking Quality Sandal
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted these sandals for awhile now, so I was very excited when they arrived. I have a pair of Merrills that are about to wear out. I tried these on about a year ago when the Merrills were fairly new and I have to say the Keen sandal gave me better support and was more comfortable. I wear these almost everyday in the summer. So comfortable and easy to slip on and off. I like this particular model because it has a toe guard. I find this very important as I stumble and do not like stubbing my toe. Ha For me, these are top shelf shoes and the style looks classy. Recommend for sure!
customer_reviews.author: LuvDrones

customer_reviews.title: After 4 months
customer_reviews.text: After just under 4 months of mild to moderate use pro: comfortable and they protect your toes. work well when dry. Cons; poor stitching neoprene throughout shoe and ankle area stitching already failing . When wet one losses about 30% of stability . ( they slide around a lot) Not worth the money , need better stitching and liner material and more research of people who buy such products .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: instant comfort
customer_reviews.text: bought one size smaller because they tend to run a size large. Perfect fit when I first put them on. Like a glove. Very comfortable from the first step. Sturdy - protects the foot well and takes walking in water with ease. Shoe soles have a lot of grip and you can feel comfortable they will hold traction and stay on. Very durable, very comfortable and they look good.
customer_reviews.author: urmoney

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband on August 2. He only wears the about once every 10 days, if that. Today they fell apart. Extremely disappointed when I pay $99. for shoes that should have lasted a lot longer. Update, I called the company and the shoes are under warranty for a year, I completed the warranty information and should hear back from them in a few weeks. Great customer service so far, changing my review from a 1 to a 3 because of that. The issues with their shoes is 0.4% (that's what I was told) so it must have been bad luck to get a shoe that would fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian Z

customer_reviews.title: Not true size
customer_reviews.text: Ordered my normal size 7,however I couldn’t get my foot in them. My wife put them on and fit her perfectly, so she kept them . Call keen before you order them. They told me these shoes run a size small, so order one size up. Ended up getting a size 8 and they fit perfect
customer_reviews.author: P Dowell

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes but this is second pair that have come unsewn in this spot. Ordered this pair a year ago because the other pair wouldn’t make it till the 2nd summer. Then barely started wearing the new pair and in few weeks has done this.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie G.

customer_reviews.title: For flat foot.
customer_reviews.text: Nice an good quality. I liked the design too. Put on this model that was a big fight. I used a shoehorn but I broke it, the second finally helped put it on. Tha was so uncomfortable and tight. My foot number exactly 8. I returned and ordered other two shoes number 8,5 and 9. Same problem. I returned them. So this model not for my foot. My foot has higher bridge and arch. This model for flat foot.
customer_reviews.author: Geza

customer_reviews.title: Best water sandals ever
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time buying any shoe over the internet. I have feet that are difficult to fit. But the sizing guides worked well and these fit perfectly. This was my second set of Keens. I can't say enough about how wonderful it is to have a wet/dry sandal. I live in the Seattle area, so a shoe that goes through puddles and mud, etc. is a must. I wore my last pair down to literally a few threads holding it together. Glad to have the new ones.
customer_reviews.author: EverettDick

customer_reviews.title: Zero customer support
customer_reviews.text: update: after a long wait Keen has honored the warranty by by providing a $100 credit directly on their website. I would have preferred they replace the sandals directly but the credit is acceptable. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ I have an issue with the left show making a very loud noise while walking. sounds line the layers of the sole are coming apart. I submitted to Keens website a warranty claim that has sat for more than 2 full weeks. I would say Keen makes an OK product but if you have an issue don't expect them to stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Steve J:

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to put on; rub on a high arch
customer_reviews.text: My son and I each tried a pair. He couldn't even get his on: the opening, even with elastic fully stretched, is just too small. My foot is smaller and it's all I could do to pull mine on. Once mine were on, they fit OK in my normal size. But they rubbed against the top of my foot so badly that I had to send them back. I checked many times and the straps were placed properly; I guess they aren't designed for a higher arch? Reasonably comfortable but my feet sweated against the plastic. Both sets went back; being replaced with something else
customer_reviews.author: W. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Really great Sandel
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. The first lasted over three years and many miles. I still wear them around the yard. Decided my original pair were a little large (10 1/2) so on this pair I ordered 10s. They fit as expected and just like my originals are great. My soles never get rubbed and and they are great to wear camping all day. Love em!
customer_reviews.author: Techie One

customer_reviews.title: They are te best sandals I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I love my Keens! 5yrs ago I bought a pair like these for a canoe trip and being the cheap scape I am, I pissed about paying $100 for sandals.. But 5yrs of wear and canoe trips and tubing they were getting very loose so I bought another pair.. and $100 isn't a bad price for these. they wear like iron, are comfortable, they protect your toes, you can wear them in the water and later wear them to dinner. I wear a size 15 and they are true to size.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost rider

customer_reviews.title: runs very small
customer_reviews.text: go a full size larger with this. I dunno what happened to Keens, but every time I guy them I gotta go larger. was a 9.5, now i am buying 10.5... and my feet are getting smaller now that i lost weight. I wish wide sizes were available too... anyway, it's a good sandal. kinda the only show in town for this kind of thing. Wish there were alternatives...
customer_reviews.author: JimmyH

customer_reviews.title: Keen Newport H2 Sandals are the SEAL TEAM 6 of Extreme Conditions Sandals!
customer_reviews.text: Third pair of Keen H2 over last 12 years. I've worn them hiking volcanos, in jungles, through oceans across the world. Their is no better all terraine water shoe available for tropical climates. Toe protection is a big deal and these Keens do the job. Every time a pair begins to come apart, I realize there is nothing else that performs as well. Tevas cannot come close to extreme conditions performance of these Keens.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: You Need This
customer_reviews.text: Usual size is 9.5 Wide but ordered size 10 regular width. Went up a size to compensate for my wide width. It fit fine. The color Navy/Grey was perfect. The straps are a mix of navy grey color. Perfect for walking on the beach, washing your car, and when you might encounter a lot of rain as it dries quickly. You need this in your closet for sure!
customer_reviews.author: IslaAnne

product_meta.title: KEEN Men's 1010942 Sandal
product_meta.description: This wear anywhere water shoe is a superstar. It has the airiness of a sandal and the toe protection of a shoe. The razor-siped sole provides excellent traction, and the washable webbing upper is ready for hiking, walking, and all your adventures, in and out of the water. Weighing 14.2 oz / 402.6 g (per shoe), made with durable, polyester webbing upper, waterproof leather and featuring a quick-dry lining, the Newport H2 Water shoe for men are built off KEEN's traditional wider footwear form. KEEN products are consciously created using a natural, pesticide-free probiotic-based technology called Eco Anti-Odor for breaking down odor in sweat, PFC-free water repellent (in applicable styles) and leather sourced from Leather Working Group (LWG)-certified tanneries. KEEN products are consciously created using a natural, pesticide-free probiotic-based technology called Eco Anti-Odor for breaking down odor in sweat, PFC-free water repellent (in applicable styles) and leather sourced from Leather Working Group (LWG)-certified tanneries.
feature_bullets: WATER-RESISTANT UPPER: Washable polyester webbing featuring quick-dry lining for active use in and out of the water; PFC-free, durable, water repellent helps shed water and prolong the quality and life of the material on these men’s water shoe

TRACTION & PROTECTION: Multi-directional lugs with razor siping help provide superior grip on slippery wet terrain; Non-marking rubber outsoles leave no imprint when walking indoors; Iconic toe bumper offers additional safety to help prevent injury
SUPPORT & COMFORT: Lace-lock bungee capture system provides a secure fit while offering quick and easy on/off; Compression-molded EVA midsole for enhanced cushioning
FIT & INSOLE: This style runs true to size; Non-removable EVA insole with added arch support for all-day comfort
CARE TIPS & ODOUR PREVENTION: All KEEN water shoes and sandals are machine washable; Use a small amount of detergent, wash on gentle cycle and air dry
